idiom.meaning: Constantly shifting loyalty for personal gain
idiom.example: The consultant constantly changed political affiliations depending on which party seemed ascendant

shortDescription: During the turbulent Warring States period, this phrase emerged to describe officials who served Qin state in the morning (朝秦) but switched to Chu by evening (暮楚).
